item.title: Blog Temporary and Universal Challenges for AI Book Review: The Hard Thing about Hard Things
item.description: Temporary and Universal Challenges for AI Philosophy :ID: 4be36886-76db-434a-ad85-43c43e2a1548 Of ancient wars and modern troubles The Romans and the Cartaginians were quite unhappy with one another for a long time. Cato the Censor certainly seemed to think so. Yet Carthage was a temporary problem. It was settled rather thoroughly by the Romans in 146 BC. Carthage, an existential problem that nearly led to the destruction of Rome, had been surmounted. The Republic soon moved on to worry about other matters.
